## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 414, 719, 430]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 429, 325, 444]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 443, 609, 459]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams, graphs or rough working.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 457, 601, 473]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 471, 380, 488]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 255, 514]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 512, 767, 543]]<|/det|>
You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units. Take the weight of \(1\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(10\mathrm{N}\) (i.e. acceleration of free fall \(= 10\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 552, 756, 584]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 599, 761, 618]]<|/det|>
Students X and Y plan to connect the lamp combination to a 240V supply.
